fields.description:
I installed eucalyptus and eucaconsole from packages on the new QA system.
I did not manage to get eucaconsole to run and saw the following errors:
 
[root@c-05 ~]# service eucaconsole status
eucaconsole dead but pid file exists

{code}
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/eucaconsole", line 114, in <module>
    start_console()
  File "/usr/bin/eucaconsole", line 79, in start_console
    load_entry_point('pyramid==1.4', 'console_scripts', 'pserve')(args)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/scripts/pserve.py", line 50, in main
    return command.run()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/scripts/pserve.py", line 304, in run
    global_conf=vars)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/scripts/pserve.py", line 328, in loadapp
    return loadapp(app_spec, name=name, relative_to=relative_to, **kw)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/PasteDeploy-1.5.0-py2.6.egg/paste/deploy/loadwsgi.py", line 247, in loadapp
    return loadobj(APP, uri, name=name, **kw)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/PasteDeploy-1.5.0-py2.6.egg/paste/deploy/loadwsgi.py", line 271, in loadobj
    global_conf=global_conf)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/PasteDeploy-1.5.0-py2.6.egg/paste/deploy/loadwsgi.py", line 296, in loadcontext
    global_conf=global_conf)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/PasteDeploy-1.5.0-py2.6.egg/paste/deploy/loadwsgi.py", line 320, in _loadconfig
    return loader.get_context(object_type, name, global_conf)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/PasteDeploy-1.5.0-py2.6.egg/paste/deploy/loadwsgi.py", line 454, in get_context
    section)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/PasteDeploy-1.5.0-py2.6.egg/paste/deploy/loadwsgi.py", line 476, in _context_from_use
    object_type, name=use, global_conf=global_conf)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/PasteDeploy-1.5.0-py2.6.egg/paste/deploy/loadwsgi.py", line 406, in get_context
    global_conf=global_conf)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/PasteDeploy-1.5.0-py2.6.egg/paste/deploy/loadwsgi.py", line 296, in loadcontext
    global_conf=global_conf)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/PasteDeploy-1.5.0-py2.6.egg/paste/deploy/loadwsgi.py", line 328, in _loadegg
    return loader.get_context(object_type, name, global_conf)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/PasteDeploy-1.5.0-py2.6.egg/paste/deploy/loadwsgi.py", line 620, in get_context
    object_type, name=name)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/PasteDeploy-1.5.0-py2.6.egg/paste/deploy/loadwsgi.py", line 640, in find_egg_entry_point
    pkg_resources.require(self.spec)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pkg_resources.py", line 648, in require
    needed = self.resolve(parse_requirements(requirements))
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pkg_resources.py", line 546, in resolve
    raise DistributionNotFound(req)
pkg_resources.DistributionNotFound: python-magic>=0.4.6
{code}

{code}
[root@c-05 ~]# yum info python-magic
Loaded plugins: fastestmirror, security
Repository 'eucaconsole' is missing name in configuration, using id
Loading mirror speeds from cached hostfile
 * extras: mirrors.usc.edu
euca2ools-release                                                                            | 1.2 kB     00:00     
eucalyptus-release                                                                           | 1.3 kB     00:00     
Installed Packages
Name        : python-magic
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 5.04
Release     : 15.el6
Size        : 16 k
Repo        : installed
From repo   : centos-6-x86_64-os
Summary     : Python bindings for the libmagic API
URL         : http://www.darwinsys.com/file/
License     : BSD
Description : This package contains the Python bindings to allow access to the
            : libmagic API. The libmagic library is also used by the familiar
            : file(1) command.

{code}
fields.summary: Console 4.1 installed via new QA fails to run

comments.body:
It appears that the correct version of python magic and dogpile cache was not installed. The workaround is to install these manually:

easy_install python-magic
easy_install dogpile.cache
[~gholms] says it is likely that the python-magic dep in setup.py is incorrect.

There are two competing python libraries for libmagic.  The one available to us is the one that ships with the {{file}} program and libmagic itself, but setup.py is instead naming the other one.  Is setup.py simply wrong or does the code also need fixing to work with the regular magic library?

Packaging knows nothing at all about dogpile.cache.  If it is required then please open a bug.

Guys, this isn't the first time surprise dependencies have broken things.  When you want to use a new library would you _please_ talk to rel-eng first so we don't have to keep dealing with this kind of setback?

[~gholms]: dogpile.cache was added to the console's setup.py on May 7 (see https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/14b1b6bdb06b6f5e120a1881e8f857f6a2d25165), so I'm somewhat surprised the missing dogpile.cache issue is cropping up now.  Have we only recently started building 4.1 packages for the console?

/cc [~dkavanagh]

honestly, it was only merged a month ago. https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/821
The changes to the rpm spec should be to add python-dogpile-cache to the list of dependencies. There is no deletion since the beaker.cache stuff is part of a larger beaker package we still use.

Okay, I added python-dogpile-cache in commit [{{c5d8013}}|https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole-rpmspec/commit/c5d80133491ef1453a2c0fbaf9f2e32f828be08a].  That should take effect the next time a build happens.  Why it took until now for anyone to notice the problem is beyond me.  :-\

What shall we do about the python-magic bit?

I'm not sure about the magic bit. Isn't this entry sufficient?
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole-rpmspec/blob/develop/eucaconsole.spec#L51

Looking further reminded me of version confusion I have. Here's the package version:
python-magic.x86_64                5.04-15.el6           centos-6-x86_64-os     

Here's the pypi version:
python_magic-0.4.6-py2.6.egg (md5)	Python Egg	2.6	2013-10-08

Since the 0.4.6 version was done about a year ago, can we assume the centos package contains it? From this, it isn't clear to me: http://rpm.pbone.net/index.php3/stat/4/idpl/23726140/dir/centos_6/com/python-magic-5.14-15.4.x86_64.rpm.html
[~gholms] ?

It is, but remember that there are two competing libmagic bindings for python that share the same module name.  The spec file is referring to the one that file and libmagic themselves ship because that is what RHEL has.  That library's name appears to be the obnoxious "Magic file extensions", at least as far as I can tell.  That doesn't match the eucaconsole's setup.py file because "python-magic" refers to the _other_ implementation.  Given the version number in setup.py, I suspect the latter is what you developed the feature against as well, so if the two are incompatible some porting work may be necessary here.

I know we chatted on IRC yesterday, [~gholms], but I wanted to confirm the path we're on.
 - The RHEL python-magic package contains the python bindings that are part of the file source package. Those aren't available on OS X (and windows, I assume), so this isn't portable as widely as we'd like.
 - The pypi python-magic package is cross-platform and works with different native libraries as needed for the platform. It has a name conflict with the RHEL package, so we could try packaging for CentOS with a different name to avoid the conflict.

Try these using the module name {{python_magic}}:
* http://temp.devzero.com/l/python-python-magic-0.4.6-0.1.el6.x86_64.rpm
* http://temp.devzero.com/l/python-python-magic-0.4.6-0.1.el6.src.rpm

The origin of the ridiculous naming is something like this:
# python-magic ships the {{magic}} library that is ships with file and libmagic themselves
# The upstream tarball and pypi package are named python-magic
# Follow the generic "prepend python- to the upstream tarball name" rule to get python-python-magic
# Change the hyphen to an underscore to get the {{python_magic}} module name

I suggest putting the {{import python_magic}} statement in a try block that can react to a failed import by attempting to {{import magic as python_magic}} and then seeing if that results in the library the console wants.  That would at least sort of make it possible to also work with direct-from-pypi installs.

I've installed the package and tested the functionality outside our app. I've also tested the import tweak inside the app on OS X and that doesn't break. I suggest we get this merged in and test with packages since I'm having trouble with source install on CentOS GUI-1338
Once I've tested this from packages, we can see about adding the dependency and getting the python-python-magic package officially added to what we package.
doing a hand-off since this was successful! If you could get this package into our repo and added to eucaconsole as a dependency, I think we can hand it off to Alice for QA!
Done.  Feel free to give it another shot, [~alice].
